alert.note: Alert for Denver (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 6:32PM MDT until May 11 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Along the lower part of Sand Creek, including the following counties, Adams and Denver. * WHEN...Until 900 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Sand creek, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations along the creek is imminent or occurring including the bike path and a portion of E. 60th Ave. Streams continue to remain high due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Additional rainfall overnight will keep the creek at high levels. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 627 PM MDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Rapid rises are possible with additional rainfall overnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northern Denver, western Aurora and southwestern Commerce City along Sand Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
